data.title: 2013 Conference
data.text:
Keynote Speaker: Kent Hopkins, Vice Provost of Enrollment Management at Arizona State University

Conference Presentations are now available online in our Member Center. To access the presentations, login to your CSIET Account. Click ‘Member Center’, then ‘Member Resources’, then ‘Conference Archive’.

We truly appreciate those who attended and supported this year’s conference. Because we want to make our sessions worth every minute of your time, if you have not already done so and were an attendee this year, please share your feedback with us by contacting anna@csiet.org.

THURSDAY, OCTOBER 17, 2013

9:00 AM – 3:00 PM: CSIET Board Meeting (Fresco Room)

3:00 PM: Exhibitor Set-Up (Third Floor Foyer)

3:00 – 7:00 PM: Conference Registration and Check-In (Third Floor Foyer)

4:00 – 5:30 PM: Pre-Conference Session (Mural Room)

Andrea Sebben

The lecture will discuss the basic characteristics of migratory experience; including adaptation strategies, the concept of culture shock, and the key to success in international youth exchange.

3:00 – 7:00 PM: Exhibits Open (Third Floor Foyer)

7:30 – 9:00 PM: Opening Reception (Third Floor Foyer)

FRIDAY, OCTOBER 18, 2013

8:00 – 9:00 AM: Continental Breakfast Buffet (Third Floor Foyer)

Breakfast of : seasonal fruits and berries, parfait, danishes, muffins, croissants, bagels, and an assortment of juices

9:00 – 10:30 AM: Membership Council Meeting (Dreamcatcher Ballroom)

Annual Report from CSIET Chair, David Vodila

Committee Reports·

2013 Elections

Executive Director Report

10:30 – 10:45 AM: Coffee Break (Third Floor Foyer)

10:45 AM – 12:15 PM: Plenary Session (Dreamcatcher Ballroom)

United States Department of State J Visa Compliance Session

Moderator: Laura Rose, CCI Greenheart

James Alexander, Private Sector Exchange, Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs, United States Department of State

Lale Kuyumcu, Private Sector Exchange, Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs, United States Department of State

U.S. State Department “J-Visa” representatives will review oversight and regulatory activities, including high school regulations and the upcoming Federal compliance audit.

12:15 – 1:45 PM: Lunch and Keynote Address (Dreamcatcher Ballroom)

Introduction by a YFU exchange student

Keynote Speaker: Kent Hopkins, Vice Provost of Enrollment Management at Arizona State University

Lunch of: McClendon’s Farm salad, marinated chicken with golden potatoes and mushroom ragout, flourless chocolate cake and vanilla ice cream

1:45 – 2:45 PM: Plenary Session (Dreamcatcher Ballroom)

Roadmap to the ELTiS

Moderator: Chris Page, CSIET

Melissa Cortez, Ballard & Tighe, Inc.

Sari Luoma, Ballard & Tighe, Inc.

Gwen Vitzthum, CCI Greenheart

Louise Reeves, YFU, USA

2:45 – 3:00 PM: Refreshment Break (Third Floor Foyer)

3:00 – 4:00 PM: Plenary Session (Dreamcatcher Ballroom)

Exchange Student Panel:

Moderator: Georgina Taddiken, STS Foundation

Young leaders share their recent study abroad experiences and their path toward leadership roles

4:00 – 5:00 PM: Concurrent Sessions

Youth Exchange and Service Learning (Calavera Junior Ballroom)

Carl Jaramillo, Minds Abroad

Laura Rose, CCI Greenheart

Mobility International (Mural Room)

Cerise Roth-Vinson, MIUSA

Emily Turner, AFS

5:15 – 5:45 PM: CSIET Board Meeting (Zia I)

6:00 – 9:00 PM: Intellicorp Dinner Reception (Lustre Deck)

SATURDAY, OCTOBER 19, 2013

8:00 – 9:00 AM: Continental Breakfast Buffet (Third Floor Foyer)

Breakfast of: seasonal fruits and berries, danishes, muffins, croissants, and fresh squeezed orange juice

9:00 – 10:15 AM: Concurrent Sessions

CSIET Education Outreach (Calavera Junior Ballroom)

Moderator: Louise Reaves, YFU-USA

Vanessa Chang, Fairfax County Public Schools (Va.), ESL

Kim Kile, Director of Guidance at Greenfield-Central High School

Leading in an F-1 Context (Dreamcatcher Ballroom)

Moderator: Chris Page, CSIET

Mary Jo Brock, AFS

Luiz Marzullo, ICES

Aumomaleahh Omar-Livingstone, The Zource

10:15 – 10:30 AM: Refreshment Break (Third Floor Foyer)

10:30 – 11:45 AM: Plenary Session (Dreamcatcher Ballroom)

Intellicorp Presentation- Criminal Background Checks

Kelly Ansboury, Intellicorp Records

Evelyn Holmes, Intellicorp Records

This session is designed to discuss with the CSIET members which products are included in each of the current bundles. As well as, inform members of Intellicorp plans for the coming cycle.

11:45 AM – 12:00 PM: Break (Third Floor Foyer)

12:00 PM – 1:00 PM: Working Luncheon (Dreamcatcher Ballroom

Federal Budget Update and U.S. Department of State Sponsored Youth Exchanges Programs

Mark Overmann, The Alliance

Michele Peters, Department of State

Amy Ballard, Youth for Understanding USA (YFU

Emily Danyluk, ACIE

A representative from the Alliance will provide an annual review of Federal legislation and funding initiatives for international exchange programming, along with a review of the Congressional appropriations process for upcoming funding cycle. A panel of State Department grantees and a representative from ECA?s Youth Programs Division will discuss how your organization can shape future leaders by working with State Department-sponsored high school exchange programs. Learn about funding opportunities for non-profit organizations and how you can get involved. CSIET Program members, both US based and International, are encouraged to attend this luncheon, where you can discuss partnership opportunities with the US Dept. of State as well as the latest developments with regard to federal funding of international educational exchange programs.

1:00 PM: Conference Adjourns
